title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora prefers not to focus on playoffs despite team's current wild-card position.
Red Sox hold the second wild-card spot in the AL, trailing Yankees by 1.5 games, Blue Jays by 4.5.
Red Sox face a challenging schedule, but analytics give them over 90% chance to make the postseason.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox chief baseball officer Craig Breslow is prioritizing hiring a general manager this offseason, according to WEEI's Rob Bradford.
The general manager position has been vacant since Breslow took over Red Sox baseball operations ahead of the 2024 season.
Assistant general managers, including Raquel Ferreira and Eddie Romero, are potential candidates for the role, with Toboni eying the Nationals.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick.
New England also gives up a 2028 seventh-round pick in the trade for Polk.
Polk had 12 receptions, 87 yards, and 2 touchdowns last season and struggled with form.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have lost their last five games in Miami, where Tua Tagovailoa is undefeated against them.
Despite a losing streak, Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel's job status is uncertain after a blowout loss to the Colts.
Dolphins' secondary weakened by departures, but pass rushers Bradley Chubb and Zach Sieler present a strong defensive front.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a haunting Southern Gothic set at Boston's Roadrunner on September 12, 2025.
Cain's show featured songs from her albums, creating an immersive narrative with a Gothic Americana atmosphere.
Special guest Jae Matthews joined Cain for the song 'Vacillator', enhancing the emotionally charged performance.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior', a film about a 59-year-old returning to college football.
Chiklis, an Andover High alum, embraced his football past despite not playing since 1980, except charity events.
The film 'The Senior' will have a pre-release screening in Boston on September 14, followed by a national release.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are featured on Forbes' list of the 400 richest Americans, ranging in rank from 27 to 382.
Abigail Johnson is the wealthiest Massachusetts resident, ranking 27th nationally with a net worth of $35 billion.
Other prominent Massachusetts billionaires include Edward Johnson IV, Robert Kraft, and Elizabeth Johnson, among others.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Red Sox lost 4-1 to the New York Yankees, managing only two hits in Friday's game at Fenway Park.
Lucas Giolito pitched 5.2 innings for the Red Sox, allowing two runs while Aaron Judge hit a first-inning homer.
The Red Sox committed three errors and went 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position, missing key opportunities.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Washington Commanders DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers a season-ending left quad injury against the Packers.
Wise, 31, was injured during a second-quarter extra point attempt and requires surgery.
Wise, a former Patriots player, signed a one-year $3.25 million contract with the Commanders in March.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early is a candidate to start Tuesday's game against the Athletics at Fenway Park.
Early struck out 11 batters over five scoreless innings in his debut, tying a Red Sox record.
Alex Cora will decide on Sunday about Early's next start, considering other pitchers like Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison.
